	charset="iso-8859-1"

And so, realizing that he has failed to make a successful comeback in NBW, =
the Hollywood Narrator decides that retirement might be the best solution. =
He has no regrets, other than that he just couldn't hold onto his spot in t=
he NBW like he wanted to. His posts, this one included, have lost all of th=
eir life and energy. He degenerates rapidly, and although he is not a bad R=
Per, like he once was, he feels that he is not up to par with alot of other=
 people. He is clueless, he does not know what is going on with the RPG and=
 does not know what to do with his characters. He feels he had a pretty goo=
d run, and at one point was almost on top. He had nearly the greatest numbe=
r of all time characters in the RPG's history, and his characters actually,=
 although through gan grape (Get it?), destroyed one of the Predacon bases.=
 He has not always been easy to work with. He's complained, he's challenged=
 things, he's argued with the highest of people, because he worked hard to =
protect what he had already established. But now, nobody misses the Hollywo=
od Narrator's posts. Nobody is interested in trying to do storylines with t=
he aging veteran. Before the character limit, he was promising. After the l=
imit happened, he just seemed to float off into space, not able to have fun=
 with his limited cast. Should the Hollywood Narrator leave? Maybe that sho=
uld be for the RPG to decide. I am in a sad state with NBW right now...
---=
---------------------------------------------------------------------------=
--------
New, New, New World Order! 4 life! 4 life!

Watcha gonna do when H=
ulkaMania runs wild on you!?
